title: Why do you think Yasuo is cancer?
body: Hello, fellow Yasuo main here. I always see Yasuo hate in a lot of places I go regarding League of legends and as I main him I would like to know why. I know a lot of people are just going to whine and cry and be annoying, but I would actually like to see some intelligent responses. (which is why im making my own thread) If you come here just to rant then you can leave, but if any of you actually have some good arguments then I will read them as i am genuinely curious. Feel free to post opinions, stories, and tell me what you main. Thank you.

replies.body:
{{champion:157}}  has an annoying kit. {{champion:17}} levels of annoying. Stupidly high mobility. Great defensive tool with his shield (that is recharged when he ults). Tilt inducing Windwall. Hard CC.

But that's not the biggest part of the problem. We have plenty of annoying kit champions. {{champion:80}}, {{champion:17}}, {{champion:86}}, {{champion:7}}, {{champion:105}}. The problem is: {{champion:157}} happens to be an hyper carry that scales extremely well into late game WHILE HAVING A STRONG EARLY AND MID GAME. He has no downtime.

{{champion:23}} used to receive hate because no matter how you fucked him over early game, he would farm himself to late game and win any 1v1. Hell, if you failed to kite him he could 3v1 with ease. But that was late game and late game only.

{{champion:157}} is given the double crit chance and 50% armor pen. This means that he has a 100% granted mid game power spike similar to being fed while also having Tyndamere-esque late game potential, but with a much better team fighting potential due to high mobility, two sources of hard CC and what is possibly the best zoning tool against ranged champions in the entire game with his Windwall.

A good Windwall has the potential to turn a team fight on it's own. No other hyper carry has this potential to win a team fight through something other than damage.

This is why Yasuo is strong and this is why he's hated. He's an utility packed hyper carry.

Any displacement will proc his ult

**Lack of cooldowns**

Yasuo has a very URF-like feel to him. Rather than "I need to properly time / aim my skills and manage my secondary resource" it feels very much like "It doesn't matter if I waste or miss anything because it will be back up in two seconds."

**Uses your minion wave against you**

Minions can do a lot of damage early game. Being in your minion wave is supposed to deter enemy champions from attacking you, as they will then take aggro. Yasuo, however, uses your minions to dash around in every direction, not only making skillshots very difficult to land but also making it very easy for him to get in, poke and then get out.

**Windwall negates an infinite number of projectiles.**

Spellshields block a certain number of skills. Windwall blocks everything. For a rather extensive period of time.

**Ult can be procced off of literally everything.**

Knockups should be things like a Malphite or Wukong ult, no Thresh's flay or Darius' E pull.
**
Because of his design as a whole, it is less about how good at your champion you are and more about how bad at Yasuo your opponent is.**

With all of the mobility, shields and damage, it honestly feels like you're hoping the Yasuo sucks rather than "I know my champion well enough to play against my opponent.

I think what makes Yasuo annoying is not his wind wall, his ultimate, his passive, or his knock up.

What makes him an annoying champion is the fact that he is able to utilize any visible target for a series of dashes. Why is this a problem? It is a problem because allied minion waves are supposed to deter enemies from going all in on you in the early game, but Yasuo is the exception to this established rule of thumb. You attack an enemy champion, you become the target of minion aggro, but Yasuo is built in a fashion that promotes making him a target to that aggro as he goes in on an enemy champion and pops back out just as quickly.

There is no hiding behind your minions to avoid Yasuo and trying to go after him when he does, you are faced with problems that Yasuo freely ignores.

Creep block and unit collision and brutal enemy minion aggro when you do try and retaliate.

Yasuo is something people habitually despise and that is a safe assassin.
